Detailed Description

A word autocompletion request.

The autocomplete service takes a word fragment — that is, a few letters — and returns words which start with that fragment. The results are based on corpus frequency, not static word lists, so you have access to more dynamic words in the language.

Initialize a new word autocomplete request using the default request parameters.

Parameters:
wordFragmentThe word fragment to be autocompleted. Words that start with this fragment will be selected based on corpus frequency and returned. A single-character '*' wild-card may be included; 't*e' would match 'the'.
maxResultCountThe maximum number of results to return, or WNUnlimitedResultLength to return the maximum number permitted by the server.
Invariant:
The results will be ordered using WNAutocompleteWordCollationFrequencyDescending.
Only words with an available dictionary definition will be returned.
+ (id) requestWithWordFragment: (NSString *)  wordFragment
skip: (NSInteger)  skip

includePartOfSpeech: (NSString*)  includePartOfSpeech

maxCorpusCount: (NSInteger)  maxCorpusCount
minDictionaryCount: (NSInteger)  minDictionaryCount
maxDictionaryCount: (NSInteger)  maxDictionaryCount
minLength: (NSInteger)  minLength
maxLength: (NSInteger)  maxLength
resultCollation: (WNAutocompleteWordCollation)  resultCollation 

Create and initialize a new word autocomplete request.

Parameters:
wordFragmentThe word fragment to be autocompleted. Words that start with this fragment will be selected based on corpus frequency and returned. A single-character '*' wild-card may be included; 't*e' would match 'the'.
maxResultCountThe maximum number of results to return, or WNUnlimitedResultLength to return the maximum number permitted by the server.
resultOffsetThe offset of the results to be returned. Can be used to paginate autocomplete results.
resultCollationThe collation (sort order) to use for the returned results.
dictionaryDefinitionRequiredIf YES, only words with an available dictionary definition will be returned.

Property Documentation

- (WNAutocompleteWordCollation) resultCollation [read, assign]

The collation to use for the returned results.

- (NSInteger) skip [read, assign]

The offset of the results to be returned.

Can be used to paginate autocomplete suggestions.

- (NSString*) wordFragment [read, assign]

The word fragment to be autocompleted.

A single-character '*' wild-card may be included; 't*e' would match 'the'.
